EVENING- PROGRAM
30 P.M. Dinner - Dr, Bruce E. Mahan (Toastmaster) Dir. of Ext. Division,
State University of Iowa.
Address - "Supplemental Broadcasting System As Proposed By The
Nat. Com. on Ed. hy Radio" - Pres. A. G. Crane,
University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyoming.
TUESDAY. SEPTEMBER 10.
30 A.M. Address - "Accomplishments and Future of the Radio Child Study
Club" - Dr. R. H. Ojemann, Iowa Child Welfare Research
Station, State University of Iowa.
Address - "The Relation Of The Speech Department To The University
Radio Station" - Prof. H. C. Harshbarger, Production
Manager,of WSUI, Iowa City.
Address - "A Message From The National Committee on Education By
Radio" - Dr. Tracy F. Tyler, Secy. & Research Dir.,
N.C.E.R.
Report of Committee on Short Wave Transmission Between Stations -
Chrm., Carl Menzer, Dir. of W$UI, Iowa City.
Question Box: Answers provided by J. F. Wrigjit, Dir. af WILL,
Urbana, Illinois.
"The WO I Music Shop". - A. G. Woolfries, Announcer WOI,
Ames, Iowa.
Business Session; report of secretary and treasurer; election
of officers.
REMARKS
I. Parallel meetings will be arranged in adjoining rooms for
the convenience of Engineers and Operators to discuss techÂ¬
nical problems. Discussion led by Carl Menzer, Director
of WSUI.
